info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 6:19PM EST until December 28 at 2:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... South Fork Catawba River At Lowell affecting Gaston County. .Runoff from recent heavy rainfall is causing rapid rises along the South Fork Catawba River at Lowell. Minor flooding is expected to develop tonight and persist through Wednesday. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Catawba River at Lowell. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, minor flooding develops. Floodwaters will begin to inundate Goat Island Park and Riverside Park. Floodwaters will approach Riverside Drive near Fifth and Sixth Streets in Cramerton. At 11.0 feet, additional flooding will develop, with floodwaters approaching homes along Catawba Run Rd. Flooding may impact the Old Willis School Road bridge near Sandcastle Road. At 11.5 feet, Minor Flooding continues. The South Fork Catawba River will likely inundate portions of Riverside Drive with several inches of water. The pumping station at Pharr Yarns in McAdenville may begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:00 PM EST Tuesday the stage was 9.1 feet and rapidly rising. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 11.4 feet tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.5 feet on 09/09/2004. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning at 630 AM EST.
